title: 91/137/EEC: Commission Decision of 18 February 1991 approving derogations provided for by Germany from certain provisions of Council Directive 77/93/EEC in respect of ware potatoes for human consumption originating in Poland (only the German text is authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION  of 18 February 1991  approving derogations provided for by Germany from certain provisions of Council Directive 77/93/EEC in respect of ware potatoes for human consumption originating in Poland  (Only the German text is  authentic)  (91/137/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Germany shall provide the Commission and the other Member States, before 1 April 1991, with information on the amounts imported pursuant to this Decision and with a detailed technical report of the official examination referred to in Article  1 (2) (k); copies of each phytosanitary certificate shall be transmitted to the Commission.

The approval granted in Article 1 shall apply from 15 December 1990 until 28 February 1991. It shall be revoked prior to 28 February 1991 if it is found that the conditions laid down in Article 1 (2) have been insufficient to prevent the  introduction of the harmful organisms in question or have not been complied with.
This Decision is addressed to the Federal Republic of Germany.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 18 February 1991.
For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 26, 31. 1. 1977, p. 20.
(2) OJ No L 16, 22. 1. 1991, p. 29.
ANNEX
Information required on the label
(referred to in Article 1 (2) (h))
1. Name of the authority issuing the label.
2. Name of the exporters' organization.
3. Indication 'Polish ware potatoes for human consumption'.
4. Variety.
5. Name of area of production.
6. Size.
7. Declared net weight.
8. Indication 'In accordance with EEC requirements laid down in Decision 91/137/EEC'.
9. A mark printed or stamped on behalf of the Polish plant protection organization.
